authorities.info_body: The Hawaii State Department of Health can share information and resources about COVID-19 across the islands using the AlohaSafe Story app.
authorities.title: Health Department
authorities.url_instructions: Enter a URL for the Health Department you would like to add

export.code_input_body: The representative from {{name}} will provide a verification code over the phone to link your data with {{name}}.
export.complete_body: By sharing your health status and location history anonymously with your community, you’re being proactive about fighting the spread of COVID-19.
export.complete_title: Thanks for keeping your community safe!
export.confirm_upload_body:
This will help in contact tracing efforts.

If you choose not to send your Location History to {{name}}, you are choosing to opt out of contact tracing efforts that help keep your community safe.
export.confirm_upload_title: Send your location history to your HA
export.consent_button_subtitle: By proceeding, you agree that your Healthcare Authority can retain your data for a period of time.
export.exit_warning_body: You will need to restart this process
export.location_consent_body:
Your location history is used by representatives of {{name}} to interview you about places you visited and when you were there.

Once you send your location history to {{name}}, they will retain your data for a specific period of time.
export.location_consent_link: Please view their privacy policy here.
export.publish_consent_body:
During the interview with {{name}} your interviewer can remove private locations, such as homes and apartments. They can also add any additional places you believe should be included.

{{name}} may share the GPS coordinates from your location history, including date, time, and duration of your visits to let others in your community know if they may have crossed paths with the virus.

I understand that the {{name}} representative will ask me verbally at the end of the interview if I consent.
export.start_body:
Call the Department of Health at: 
(808) 586-4586
to work with a representative.
export.start_title: Provide your ANONYMIZED location history to the secure Hawaii server if you have tested POSITIVE for COVID-19.

no_data.explanation: This happens when location access is disabled for your PathCheck app or the date selected was more than 14 days ago. No exposure notifications will be available for this day.
no_data.title: No information available for this day

no_known.explanation: Your exposure history will be updated if this changes in the future.
no_known.title: No reports received at this time

explanation.gps: For {{duration}} throughout this day, your phone was within 100 feet of someone who was later diagnosed with COVID-19.

gps.how_does_this_work_para:
Whenever location access is enabled for your AlohaSafe Story app, the app saves the following information about each place you take your phone: the GPS coordinates, date, and times your phone was at that location.

This information is stored in an encrypted list within your phone for 14 days.
gps.why_did_i_get_an_en_para: You will receive exposure notifications when your PathCheck app estimates that your phone was, for an extended period, within 100 feet of another individual who later received a positive diagnosis and chose to share their location diary with their local Health Department.

exposure_history.why_did_i_get_an_en: Why did I get an exposure notification?

gps.all_services_on_no_ha_available: You will not receive exposure notifications while you are outside a region served by Health Department partners
gps.all_services_on_subheader:
Mahalo for adding your device to the fight against COVID-19!

This data will help Hawaii's contact tracing process.

AlohaSafe Story is saving the places you visit to create your private location diary.
gps.auto_start_subheader: AlohaSafe Story needs to be able to auto start to privately save the places you visit. Please enable it in your app settings
gps.tracing_off_subheader: AlohaSafe Story needs location access in Settings to privately save the places you visit

shared.no_authorities_subheader: Your phone is outside any areas covered by AlohaSafe Story
shared.notifications_off_subheader: You will not receive notifications about possible exposures nor when new Health Departments are added in your area
shared.select_authority_subheader: Select your local Health Department to receive info about COVID-19 in your area

import.error: Something went wrong while importing your data.

google.disclaimer: AlohaSafe Story has no affiliation with Google and never shares your data.
google.file_open_error:
Could not open the file. 
Please, make sure the file is opened from Google Drive
google.instructions_detailed:
Visit Google Takeout and export your Location History using the following settings: 
1. Delivery method: "Add to Drive" 
2. Frequency: "Export once" 
3. File type & size: ".zip" and "1GB"
4. Google sends an email when the export is ready 
5. Return here to import locations from Google Drive
google.instructions_first: Adding location data from Google will give you a head start on building your recent locations.
google.instructions_second: Before you can import, you must first "Take out" your location data from Google.
google.invalid_file_format:
Provided file format is not supported. 
Supported formats: ".zip".
google.no_recent_locations: Takeout doesn't have any recent locations.
google.title: Google Maps

mockData.instruction_info: Data must be in JSON format!
mockData.url_instructions: Enter a URL containing test location data you would like to add

import.subtitle: To see if you encountered someone with COVID-19 prior to downloading this app, you can import your personal location history.
import.title: Import Locations

label.about_para:
AlohaSafe Story is supported by the Hawaii State Department of Health and developed on a platform created by the PathCheck Foundation, a non-profit organization committed to providing free software to help stop the spread of COVID-19 and protect the privacy of individuals. 

For more information, visit
label.doctors_image: Illustration of a doctor and nurse wearing masks
label.launch_screen2_header_location: AlohaSafe Story remembers the places you visit and saves them privately on your phone for 14 days.
label.launch_screen2_subheader_location: Your AlohaSafe Story location diary is encrypted and never leaves your phone unless you choose to send it to a contact tracer at the Department of Health.
label.launch_screen3_header_location: Help contain the spread of the virus and protect others in your community.
label.launch_screen3_subheader_location: If you are diagnosed, you can choose to share your location diary with the Department of Health so they can anonymously inform others who may have crossed paths with the virus.
label.launch_screen4_header_location: Be notified when your PathCheck app estimates that you may have crossed paths with the virus.
label.launch_screen4_subheader_location: Learn the dates of possible exposures and see daily cumulative possible exposure time.
label.legal_page_address:
Hawaii State Department of Health
1250 Punchbowl Street
Honolulu, HI 96813
label.location_enabled_message: AlohaSafe Story is securely storing your GPS coordinates once every five minutes on this device.
label.push_at_risk_message: You have crossed paths with a COVID-19 patient

data.delete_warning_body: This will delete your location history stored on this phone.

onboarding.eula_message: *You must accept in order to use AlohaSafe Story
onboarding.location_header: To determine when you may have crossed paths with the virus, AlohaSafe Story needs location access.
onboarding.location_subheader:
Your AlohaSafe Story location diary only includes GPS coordinates, dates, and times.

Your data will not be shared with anyone unless you choose to do so.
onboarding.notification_header: Would you like to receive notifications when you may have crossed paths with the virus?
onboarding.notification_subheader: PathCheck partners with local Health Departments to track the virus. If you are located in a jurisdiction served by one of our Health Department partners, you can receive exposure notifications from your Health Department.

errors.invalid_email: The email seems to be invalid, please check again

report_issue.name: Full Name
report_issue.success: We received your feedback. Thank you!
